bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Francisco Dominguez Roldan, August 14, 1940

div1.p: Hench inquires whether Roldan has an English translation of a book on Finlay which was originally written in French. Roldan had loaned the French version to him.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Francisco Dominguez Roldan, August 14, 1940
div1.opener:
August 14, 1940
Dr. Francisco Dominguez
Gutierrez y Mendoza
Reparto San Martin
Marianao, Havana
Cuba
My dear Doctor Dominguez:
div1.p:
When I was doing some medical historical researches on the
work of Finlay and Walter Reed in Havana last April, I had the pleasure of
meeting you at the Finlay Institute. I have been asked to prepare a paper
on the conquest of yellow fever to be presented this Fall on the occasion
of the dedication of a Lazear Memorial Building at Washington and Jefferson
College.

To help me in preparing this talk, you were kind enough to
give me one of your books on the work of Finlay, published in French. At
that time, I was told that an American translation was available. I have
been unable to find this and do not know whether such a translation was
actually published, or whether you merely had copies of it in your personal
possession. I would appreciate greatly if I were to be allowed to have to
borrow one of these English translations. May I express my deep appreciation
for your help in this regard.
div1.closer: Very sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
